posts.post_content:
Pretty awesome considering there is no more mana burn.  
The mana gained from attacking with her is only useful for instants or abilities that can be played as instants so there are many times when it might not have a good use.  
A big drawback people aren't talking about is the Legendary status.

Posted By: EternalLurker (3/25/2011 4:50:33 PM)

posts.post_content:
I love how she's awesome as a general she's somewhat disposable. Usually when your general hits the field it signs it's own death certificate but Radha comes out early and lets you play your real threats with mana acceleration and without letting up on the aggro.  
It was a let down when I found out I couldn't float the RR she makes to my second main phase but that doesn't keep her from being awesome. (Still the biggest let down since I learned that [Sigil Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil Captain) effects don't stack though :( )
posts.html:

Posted By: TPmanW (5/19/2011 9:42:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Fast general who can also be quite useful in the late game. In my EDH deck, I've found she works quite well with [War Cadence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=War Cadence) and [Captive Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captive Flame). She's also very nice for flipping morph creatures such as [Krosan Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krosan Colossus) early. She's one of those generals who probably won't be targeted right away in a multiplayer game since people may not consider her to be worth their removal depending on what others are playing. The only problem is helping her not die when she attacks.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: With mana burn gone she now plays a little differently. Now she doesn't hurt you with the extra mana but what you can use it on is more limited due to mana pools emptying at the end of steps as opposed to just phases. Now you can only use the RR during declare attackers.
posts.html:
With mana burn gone she now plays a little differently. Now she doesn't hurt you with the extra mana but what you can use it on is more limited due to mana pools emptying at the end of steps as opposed to just phases. Now you can only use the RR during declare attackers.

Posted By: Wprundv (10/2/2011 12:04:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The problem is, that red mana is only going to be available during that combat phase. Basically, you get free red combat tricks with her. [Brute Force](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brute Force) is an obvious choice, especially if combined with [Kindled Fury](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kindled Fury), but any creature, sorcery, enchantment, etc. isn't going to be useful to her.  
  
Still, she's really well designed and a lot of fun. Combat tricks and instant speed burn abound, and just tapping a la [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves) is another handy trick. A very cheap, very efficient beater with utility.
posts.html:
The problem is, that red mana is only going to be available during that combat phase. Basically, you get free red combat tricks with her. Brute Force is an obvious choice, especially if combined with Kindled Fury, but any creature, sorcery, enchantment, etc. isn't going to be useful to her.

Still, she's really well designed and a lot of fun. Combat tricks and instant speed burn abound, and just tapping a la Llanowar Elves is another handy trick. A very cheap, very efficient beater with utility.

posts.post_content: There wasn't really any issue of mana burn with her unless you left a R or RR in the pool. Her effect has the word "may", which means optional. You can choose not to add that mana to your mana pool when she attacks. Unlike [Magus of the Vineyard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Vineyard) which is a forced adding mana to the mana pool.
posts.html:
There wasn't really any issue of mana burn with her unless you left a R or RR in the pool. Her effect has the word "may", which means optional. You can choose not to add that mana to your mana pool when she attacks. Unlike Magus of the Vineyard which is a forced adding mana to the mana pool.
